snippet: A federal appeals court has upheld a ruling requiring the State Department of Corrections to provide gender reassignment surgery for an inmate serving a life sentence for murdering his wife.
abstract: Federal appeals court in Massachusetts upholds ruling requiring the State Department of Corrections to provide gender reassignment surgery for inmate Michelle Kosilek, who was born male but is receiving hormone treatments in prison; Kosilek, who was named Robert when convicted, is serving a life sentence for murdering his wife.
lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court has upheld a ruling requiring the State Department of Corrections to provide gender reassignment surgery for an inmate serving a life sentence for murdering his wife.

headline.main: Massachusetts: Court Upholds Sex Change for Inmate
